website_summaries.verdict: StarCraft II: Legacy of the Void is both a fantastic conclusion to Blizzard's five-year saga and a great entry point into one of the most complex, but satisfying, strategy games ever. It's a towering achievement.
pros: Brilliant real-time strategy gameplay is perfectly balanced and infinitely complex
Co-op modes ease in new players
cons: Altered multiplayer pace may be divisive
Lower price reflects smaller amount of new content

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid game and just about worth the money in my opinion. However, I still think Wings of Liberty is by far the pick of the bunch. I found the Protoss hard to relate to and the story ultimately a bit dreary. It was a real chore talking to the characters on deck. The missions are also a little bit repetitive; far too many of them revolve around taking down multiple 'power cores' of some description. I still recommend the game but it might be worth waiting until you can pick it up on sale if you want best value for money.
customer_reviews.author: MikeHotel

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: Love this game. I'm a starcraft fanboy already, but the campaign in this is very very good. Heart of the Swarm felt like a bit of a middle child, not much happened and it meandered a bit. LotV avoids that and feels epic and meaningful from the start. Lots of old favourites from Brood War are back and it really feels like the best version of the game could ever be. Haven't even gotten to the Coop missions yet which are supposed to be great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Inflatable Muffin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game, it uses battle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game, it uses battle.net. As I already had the original StarCraft installed, the game didn't even need to install or download anything extra. I registered the key on my account and was able to play straight away.
customer_reviews.author: Customer#2037

customer_reviews.title: Runs on all systems..
customer_reviews.text: the fist game I love and the one I play since 1998. I must say SC 2 is not that great as previous one. The interface change several times, bugs all over, bad customer service and servers are not great.

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT GAME!
customer_reviews.text: Fanatic game! This is one of the best games thatI've ever played and it was a lot better then I expected, I expected it to be really good but Blizzard did even better then good with this game and I hope they make a Starcraft 3 series

customer_reviews.text: I love the SC2 games and this one was a great finisher for the series. If you liked ANY SC2 games, I urge you to try out this game.

customer_reviews.title: great game well worth the pennies
customer_reviews.text: brill third part to this series - well worth the wait - each game has improved on the last with excellent new features particularly the co-op mode - very easy to jump in and play as evidenced by my son who got to grips with the game in no time at all - great buy - keep up the good work blizzard you never disappoint -

customer_reviews.title: May be a good game but it is REALLY FRUSTRATING to pay 15 ...
customer_reviews.text: May be a good game but it is REALLY FRUSTRATING to pay 15 quid for a setup file on a CD. If I wanted to download I would! It was not stated anywhere that this is the case so I'm very very disappointed and I'm giving BLIZZARD a 1 STAR! Seller is Fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hristo E.

customer_reviews.title: If you bought this to avoid downloads...your in for a shock.
customer_reviews.text: The supplied disks do NOT contain the full game. DO NOT BUY THIS if you have a metered internet or bad connection. Once installed from disc you need a further 9GB downloaded from Battlenet before it is even playable. This is NOT advertised on the product.
customer_reviews.author: GC

product_meta.title: Starcraft 2: Legacy Of The Void (PC/Mac)
product_meta.description:
Edition:StandardYour Life for Aiur!

Legacy of the Void casts you in the role of Hierarch Artanis, leader of the technologically advanced protoss race. Years ago, the protoss homeworld of Aiur fell to the merciless zerg Swarm. Now, you have raised a powerful fleet of warships known as the Golden Armada and are poised to reclaim your world. But an ancient evil threatens your destiny and the fate of the entire Koprulu Sector. The galaxy’s only hope is for you to reunite the protoss factions and defeat the coming darkness.



 * Get Your Arch On – With the cooperative Archon Mode, you and a friend share control over a single base and army. Develop detailed game plans and focus your attentions to take down your adversaries.
 * Form Alliances – With the Allied Commanders cooperative mode, join forces with a friend and take on the role of a StarCraft commander as you battle through scenarios, level up, and show off your real-time strategy skill in a team environment.
 * Strike from the Shadows – Explore the strategic depths of the game with six fresh units – two for each race – and enjoy new abilities for the units you already know and love.
 * Experience the Epilogue – After you play through the Prologue and the Protoss single-player campaign, wrap up the StarCraft II trilogy storyline by finding out what happens to each race in the Epilogue.
 * Unique Portraits and a New Unit Skin – Unlock three unique Protoss-inspired portraits for StarCraft II and dominate your enemies in style with your new Protoss unit skin.



BOX CONTAINS


 * Full Legacy of the Void game
 * StarCraft Warrior Hero for Heroes of the Storm
